title: Superman
review: You can never get disappointed by Superman

title: Weapons
review: The mystery is built masterfully. But once we find out who or what is behind the horror, all I could think is, 'That's it?' I hoped there was more to the story or somewhere interesting the plot could go from there. But there really isn't.

title: Sinners
review: I love it when movies mix different genres and create a fresh spin on old themes. In this case however the different elements didn't mix well in my opinion: I would describe sinners as a mix between period gangster drama, musical and trashy B-movie horror.

title: One Battle After Another
review: One Battle After Another is a very unusual and engaging film with an interesting story and unexpected humor. Leonardo DiCaprio delivers a strong performance, though his character feels intentionally passive - he doesn't really manage or control the main events, which made me question the idea behind his characterization.

title: Jurassic World: Rebirth
review: New chapter in the Jurassic franchise with fresh cast and story. A complete reboot not connected to previous World trilogy.

title: Frankenstein
review: Guillermo del Toro's adaptation of Mary Shelley's classic novel. Dark fantasy reimagining with all-star cast.

title: Happy Gilmore 2
review: Sequel to the 1996 golf comedy classic. Adam Sandler returns as the hot-tempered hockey player turned golfer.

title: Thunderbolts
review: MCU's anti-hero team of reformed villains and anti-heroes on a government mission. Marvel's answer to Suicide Squad.

title: Mission: Impossible - Final Reckoning
review: Continuation and conclusion of Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning. Tom Cruise returns for more death-defying stunts.

title: F1
review: Brad Pitt stars in Formula 1 racing film directed by Joseph Kosinski (Top Gun: Maverick). Filmed during actual Grand Prix races.
